wikipedia_page.main: Lisa Watson (born 1969) is the editor of the Falkland Islands' Penguin News. Prior to her tenure, the newspaper was subsidized by the government. She raised advertising revenues to make the paper financially independent and remove the potentiality that the government was controlling the content of the news.

response: Today, the newspaper's finances are sound. The staff consists of the Managing Editor, Deputy Editor, Journalist and Office Manager, who produce a twenty-page, part colour publication printed in Stanley. The current Managing Editor is sixth generation Falkland Islander Lisa Watson. She reports directly to the Falkland Islands Media Trust.
